CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 30, 1941, pg. 1 reads: "Joseph F. Watts, Hoseman at Engine Company 58, displaying a smile of victory after being ordered back to work with full pay for a 10-day suspension growing out of a fight at the engine house in which Watts declared he acted only as a peacemaker. The Fireman's Trial Board found him guilty of disorderly conduct and ordered the suspension.  The Pittsburgh Civil Service Commission thought different and reversed the decision. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Joseph F. Watts wearing hat and sleeve garters, seated on desk in front of wall with photographs of fire engines and fire fighters
